people.name: Philippa Marrack
people.description: Philippa "Pippa" Marrack FRS  is an English biologist, based in the United States, best known for her research into T cell development, T cell apoptosis and survival, adjuvants, autoimmune disease, and for identifying superantigens, the mechanism behind toxic shock syndrome.

people.name: David Daniell
people.description: David Daniell  is an English literary scholar and editor of specialist books, mainly about William Tyndale and his translations of the Bible.

people.name: Jerry Donohue
people.description: Jerry Donohue  was an American theoretical and physical chemist.

people.name: Frank Capra
people.description: Frank Russell Capra  was an Italian-American film director, producer and writer who became the creative force behind some of the major award-winning films of the 1930s and 1940s.

people.name: Neville Chamberlain
people.description: Arthur Neville Chamberlain, FRS  was a British Conservative politician who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from May 1937 to May 1940.

people.name: Peter Medawar
people.description: Sir Peter Brian Medawar OM CBE FRS  was a British biologist born in Brazil, whose work on graft rejection and the discovery of acquired immune tolerance was fundamental to the practice of tissue and organ transplants.

people.name: John Sulston
people.description: Sir John Edward Sulston FRS  is a British biologist.

people.name: Martin Evans
people.description: Sir Martin John Evans FRS FMedSci  is an English biologist who, with Matthew Kaufman, was the first to culture mice embryonic stem cells and cultivate them in a laboratory in 1981.
